prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The National Police Air Service has shared a video of what it was like flying through Storm Gerrit's heavy winds, in a helicopter.

The footage, which was captured from inside the cockpit, shows the chopper rocking side to side, after being hit by winds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

Posting on X, formerly known as Twitter, the NPAS said "If you think it's windy down there, spare a thought for us up here in our flying washing machine".

The footage was filmed near Lea Valley reservoirs, North London.
stories:
The National Police Air Service has released a video showcasing the intense experience of navigating Storm Gerrit's powerful gusts in a helicopter.

The cockpit-captured footage reveals the aircraft violently swaying from side to side after being battered by winds reaching speeds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

On X, the NPAS joked, "While you're feeling the wind down below, consider our plight up here in our airborne spin cycle".

The video was recorded above the Lea Valley reservoirs in North London.

A video has been released by the National Police Air Service, providing a gripping glimpse into the challenges of flying a helicopter through Storm Gerrit's fierce winds. 

The in-cockpit footage shows the helicopter being tossed violently from side to side, struggling to withstand gusts of up to 80mph (128km/h).

In a lighthearted comment on X, the NPAS quipped, "As you're feeling the gusts down on the ground, spare a thought for us up here, caught in our aerial washing machine".

The footage was captured above the Lea Valley reservoirs in North London.

The National Police Air Service has shared a thrilling video that offers a firsthand look at the difficulties of navigating a helicopter through the intense winds of Storm Gerrit.

The cockpit footage reveals the helicopter being severely jolted from side to side, battling to resist powerful gusts reaching speeds of up to 80mph (128km/h).

In a humorous remark on social media, the NPAS joked, "While you're experiencing the strong gusts on the ground, remember us up here, stuck in our aerial spin cycle".

The footage was recorded above the Lea Valley reservoirs in North London.
